chinese: [C] （尤指建于林中或山上的）小木屋
[C] 流星
having the appearance, smell, or taste of smoke 似烟的；有烟熏味的
examples: e.g. Standing on the platform, we could see the [[smoky]] outline of the farther shore.

chinese: [C] a long line or a series of marks that have been left by sb. / sth. 痕迹
examples: e.g. The wounded elephant left a [[trail]] of blood behind it.；e.g. A plane [[trailing]] a banner was circling overhead.

chinese: pull sth. behind you, esp. along the ground, or be pulled in this way 拖；拉；拖在后面
examples: e.g. The wounded elephant left a [[trail]] of blood behind it.；e.g. A plane [[trailing]] a banner was circling overhead.

chinese: like sugar 糖状的；粒状表面的
examples: e.g. Rhyolites (流纹岩) are rocks with a rather distinctive [[sugary]] texture or "feel."

chinese: [C] 冬至
too special, valuable, or unusual to be replaced by anything else （因太特别、贵重或少见而）不可替代的，独一无二的
examples: e.g. The works of art that were burned in the big fire are [[irreplaceable]].

chinese: 1) a regular pattern of changes 规则变化；节律模式；节奏
examples: e.g. Long journeys can disrupt your body's natural [[rhythm]].；e.g. She started moving to the [[rhythm]] of the music.

chinese: 2) a regular repeated pattern of sounds or movements 节律；节拍；节奏
examples: e.g. Long journeys can disrupt your body's natural [[rhythm]].；e.g. She started moving to the [[rhythm]] of the music.

chinese: [U] the time when it begins to get dark in the evening 黄昏；傍晚
examples: e.g. Don't worry, Michael. We'll all be back by [[nightfall]].

chinese: [C] a period of time at night when people regularly work, esp. in a factory （尤其工厂的）夜班
examples: e.g. She is on the [[night shift]] this week, but on the day shift next week.

chinese: likely to exist, happen, or be true 可能存在的；可能发生的；很可能的
examples: e.g. The [[probable]] result of global warming will be a rise in sea levels.

chinese: [C, U] a decrease in the amount, size, or price of sth., or the act of decreasing sth. （数量、尺寸或价格的）减少，缩小，下降
examples: e.g. The company promised they would make no staff [[reductions]] for at least two years.

chinese: [C] 激素；荷尔蒙
[U] 褪黑激素（有时用作安眠药）
[C] (medical) a mental or physical illness which prevents part of your body from working properly 失调；紊乱；障碍
examples: e.g. After weeks of tests they discovered that he had a rare [[disorder]] of the lung.

chinese: [U] 糖尿病
[U] a condition in which sb. is too fat in a way that is dangerous for their health 过度肥胖
examples: e.g. [[Obesity]] can lead to heart disease and other health problems.

chinese: (of birds, animals, etc.) travel regularly from one part of the world to another （鸟、兽等）迁徙
examples: e.g. More than two million ducks [[migrate]] to the lake each fall.

chinese: [C] (AmE also turtle) 海龟
[C] a small animal or insect that destroys crops or food supplies （毁坏庄稼或食物的）有害小动物，害虫
examples: e.g. I hope it won't be long before we can get rid of the [[pests]] altogether.

chinese: [C] 推土机
damage or destroy sth. 破坏；损坏；毁坏
examples: e.g. The building had been [[wrecked]] by the explosion.

chinese: [C, U] the natural home of a plant or animal （动植物的）生活环境；（动物的）栖息地
examples: e.g. These measures will protect the [[habitat]] of endangered species such as wolves.

chinese: prevent sth. from continuing in its usual way by causing problems 扰乱；使混乱
examples: e.g. Climate change and extreme weather could seriously [[disrupt]] the agricultural economy.

chinese: [C] all the animals and plants in a particular area, and the way in which they are related to each other and to their environment 生态系统
examples: e.g. Many species of burrowing (掘洞的) insects are essential for maintaining a healthy soil [[ecosystem]].

chinese: 1) suddenly fail or become too weak to continue 突然失败；垮掉；崩溃
examples: e.g. The country's auto industry nearly [[collapsed]] due to increased foreign competition.；e.g. The roof [[collapsed]] under the weight of the snow.

chinese: 2) fall down or fall in suddenly, often after breaking apart 倒坍；塌下
examples: e.g. The country's auto industry nearly [[collapsed]] due to increased foreign competition.；e.g. The roof [[collapsed]] under the weight of the snow.

chinese: make a light shine on sth., or fill a place with light 照射；照亮
examples: e.g. A small path was [[illuminated]] by orange lamps concealed in the flower beds.

chinese: 1) private and friendly so that you feel comfortable 幽静舒适的；温馨的
examples: e.g. The guests at the country club always enjoy its [[intimate]] atmosphere.；e.g. We're not on [[intimate]] terms with our neighbors.

chinese: 2) having an extremely close friendship 亲密的；密切的
examples: e.g. The guests at the country club always enjoy its [[intimate]] atmosphere.；e.g. We're not on [[intimate]] terms with our neighbors.

chinese: [C, U] hot bright burning gas that you see when sth. is on fire 火焰
examples: e.g. They sat around the campfire, watching the flickering (摇曳的) [[flames]].

chinese: [U] the state of being completely alone, esp. when this is pleasant or relaxing 独处
examples: e.g. He spent his free time in [[solitude]], reading or walking in the hills.

chinese: extremely useful 极有价值的
examples: e.g. His experience of teaching in overseas schools proved [[invaluable]].

chinese: expressing deep, usu. sad, emotions 深情的；伤感的
examples: e.g. Jeanne was a romantic, mysterious young woman with [[soulful]] blue eyes and brown skin.

chinese: having many stars 布满星星的
examples: e.g. We had our dinner on the grassland underneath a [[starry]] sky.

chinese: 1) [sing.] a thick covering or area of sth. 厚（的覆盖）层
examples: e.g. The valley was covered with a [[blanket]] of mist.

chinese: 2) [C] 毯子；毛毯
examples: e.g. The valley was covered with a [[blanket]] of mist.

chinese: become or make sth. become smaller or less （使）减小；（使）减少
examples: e.g. Her enthusiasm for knitting is by now [[diminishing]] fast.

chinese: [C] a building, statue, or other large structure that is built to remind people of an important event or famous person 纪念碑；纪念塔；纪念馆
examples: e.g. These are the [[monuments]] to generations of individual farmers ploughing (犁) their fields.

chinese: in the process of becoming sth. or being made 在形成中；在生产中
examples: e.g. His book was finally published. He said that it was 10 years [[in the making]].

english: simply put / to put it simply
chinese: used for saying that you are explaining sth. in a clear and simple way 简单地说
examples: e.g. Anyway, simply put, we still owe them a large amount of money.

chinese: available only in small quantities, so that there is not enough 供应不足；短缺
examples: e.g. Electricity and fresh water are [[in short supply]] on the island.

chinese: 明尼苏达州（位于美国北部）
银河
(WHO) 世界卫生组织
(AMA) 美国医学会
文森特・凡・高（荷兰画家）
(National Aeronautics and Space Administration) 美国国家航空航天局
